channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: The DOD told trans troops to get diagnosed. It's using the paper trail to kick them out
item.description: As the Department of Defense removes trans troops as part of the new ban, the Air Force is enacting some new rules that leaves them with no due processâ€¦and in some cases, no benefits.

item.title: Why one federal health worker is urging Health Secretary RFK Jr. to resign
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Dr. Elizabeth Soda, who is one of more than 1,000 federal health workers urging Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to resign.

item.title: Author Ocean Vuong shares what his mother taught him about storytelling
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Author Ocean Vuong reflects on what his mother taught him about storytelling.

item.title: How 'Sesame Street' got its start
item.description: NPR's history show, Throughline, takes us back to 1969 and the creation of the children's TV show Sesame Street.

item.title: How long can Russia and Ukraine wage war at this level?
item.description: There's still no end in sight to Russia-Ukraine war, according to NPR correspondents in both countries. Peace efforts appear to be going nowhere and the fighting remains intense.

item.title: In Florida, street art will soon be a thing of the past
item.description: Murals and drawing on streets across Florida are vanishing. Not just the rainbow-painted crosswalks, but also murals honoring police. That's because the state says they're a "safety issue."

item.title: A small vacation resort area in Michigan is one of the top markets for marijuana sales
item.description: A tiny township in Michigan, best known as a vacation resort area, has become one of the top markets for marijuana sales. And it now has a new nickname: New Puffalo.

item.title: Many Venezuelans are watching and waiting amid U.S. tensions
item.description: With U.S. warships already off Venezuela's coast, many there fear what could come next, while others dismiss the U.S. administrations display of power as pure theatre.

item.title: Epstein accusers shared their stories on Capitol Hill, calling for justice
item.description: A bipartisan group of House lawmakers are continuing their push to compel the full release of federal files on convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Leaders of China, Russia and North Korea gather in Beijing for WWII parade
item.description: Leaders of China, North Korea and Russia met for the first time in one place on Wednesday as Beijing staged an elaborate parade to mark the end of WWII.
